alert.note: Alert for Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham; Inland Liberty; Inland McIntosh (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 17 at 4:43AM EST until December 18 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following areas, Coastal Bryan, Coastal Chatham, Coastal Liberty, Coastal McIntosh, Inland Bryan, Inland Chatham, Inland Liberty, Inland McIntosh and Long and southeast South Carolina, including the following areas, Beaufort, Charleston, Coastal Colleton, Coastal Jasper, Dorchester, Inland Berkeley, Inland Colleton, Inland Jasper and Tidal Berkeley. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread heavy rains will continue this morning and early this afternoon as a strong nor`easter impacts the region. Rainfall amounts of 4 to 7 inches and locally higher can be expected. There will be a risk for flash flooding as heavy rains could occur around high tide late this morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham; Inland Liberty; Inland McIntosh
